articles.title: Scientists discover first gene proven to directly cause mental illness
articles.description: Scientists have discovered that a single gene, GRIN2A, can directly cause mental illness—something previously thought to stem only from many genes acting together. People with certain variants of this gene often develop psychiatric symptoms much earlier than expected, sometimes in childhood instead

articles.title: Fast depression relief? Nitrous oxide shows remarkable potential
articles.description: Nitrous oxide may offer quick, short-term relief for people with major depression, especially those who haven’t responded to standard medications. articles.title: A tiny ocean worm just revealed a big secret about how eyes evolve
articles.description: Scientists found that adult bristleworm eyes grow continuously thanks to a rim of neural stem cells similar to those in vertebrate eyes. articles.title: Monumental Roman basin hidden for 2,000 years unearthed near Rome
articles.description: Archaeologists excavating the ancient Roman city of Gabii have uncovered a massive stone-lined basin that may represent one of Rome’s earliest monumental civic structures.
